About

ðŸ‘‹ My name is Alexa. I’m a professional software developer, amateur home chef, craft cocktail enthusiast, book lover, and video game nerd.

I built this website with Eleventy. Eleventy is perfect for simple static sites because it’s very easy to get started with and the build output is just html.

For the GitHub chart at the top of the page (not visible on mobile), I created an SVG graph and hooked into GitHub’s GraphQL API to get my contribution data. I’m using plain ‘ol JavaScript to change the tile fills. It looks sparse now because I started tracking on the first of the year, but it should look pretty neat by December.

The post your reading is pulled from a WordPress site using GraphQL & node-fetch. I had to install the WPGraphQL plugin on my site, then after that things just worked!
